00002 Plot Holder which is baseclass for wx holder for 
00003 each "backend" (matplotlib, gnuplot, vtk)

00010 def show_tree(obj,d=0):
00011     """Handy function for displaying a tree of graph objects"""
00012     print "%s%s" % ("-"*d,obj.__class__.__name__)
00013     if 'get_children' in dir(obj):
00014         for a in obj.get_children(): show_tree(a,d+1)
00015      
00016 class Plotter(wx.Panel):
00017     """Plotter for matplotlib wrapped in a wx panel
00018 
00019     All plotter rendering will consist of the following steps:
00020 
00021        plot.clear()
00022        plot.properties()
00023        plot.points()/plot.curve()/...
00024        plot.render()
00025     """
00026     
00027     def __init__(self,parent,size=None):
00028         """
00029         Define the plotting panel for the graph.
00030         """
00031         wx.Panel.__init__(self, parent=parent, id=-1)
00032         self.parentparent=parent
00033         self.plotItemsplotItems=parent.plotItems
00034 
00035         # Add the plot widget
00036         self._add_plot_widget_add_plot_widget()
00037 
00038         # Define some constants
00039         self.colorlistcolorlist = ['b','g','r','c','m','y']
00040         self.symbollistsymbollist = ['o','x','^','v','<','>','+','s','d','D','h','H','p']
00041         
00042     def addLine(self,x,y):
00043         # TODO: eventually will specify which figure and axes we want to add to
00044         line, = self.axesaxes.plot(x,y)
00045         
00046         PlotItemRegistry.lines=PlotItemRegistry.lines+1
00047         #self.plotItems.append(['line',line])   
00048         self.plotItemsplotItems['line'+str(PlotItemRegistry.lines)]=line  
00049         # this method should be called anytime a new object is loaded into the plot
00050         self.parentparent.plotBrowser.updateList()  
00051 
00052     def _add_plot_widget(self):
00053         """
00054         Add the plotting widget to the panel
00055         """
00056         # for now make it interactive, although in a real gui one will want to toggle this with a button
00057         matplotlib.interactive(True)
00058         # Put a figure on the panel, add some axes and put it on a canvas
00059         self.figurefigure = Figure()
00060         self.axesaxes   = self.figurefigure.add_subplot(111)
00061         self.canvascanvas = FigureCanvas(self,-1,self.figurefigure)
00062         #self.lines = None
00063         #self.plotItems.append(['figure',self.figure])
00064         #self.plotItems.append(['axes',self.axes])
00065         #self.plotItems['canvas']=self.canvas
00066         self.plotItemsplotItems['figure']=self.figurefigure
00067         self.plotItemsplotItems['axes']=self.axesaxes
00068 
00069         # On Windows, default frame size behaviour is incorrect
00070         # you don't need this under Linux
00071         if False:
00072             tw, th = self.toolbar.GetSizeTuple()
00073             fw, fh = self.canvascanvas.GetSizeTuple()
00074             self.toolbar.SetSize(wx.Size(fw, th))
00075 
00076         # Layout the window
00077         sizer = wx.BoxSizer(wx.VERTICAL)
00078         sizer.Add(self.canvascanvas, 1, wx.LEFT|wx.TOP|wx.GROW)
00079         self.SetSizer(sizer)  
00080 
00081     def properties(self,prop):
00082         """Set some properties of the graph.
00083         
00084         The set of properties is not yet determined.
00085         """
00086         # The particulars of how they are stored and manipulated (e.g., do 
00087         # we want an inventory internally) is not settled.  I've used a
00088         # property dictionary for now.
00089         #
00090         # How these properties interact with a user defined style file is
00091         # even less clear.
00092 
00093         # Properties defined by plot
00094         self.axesaxes.set_xlabel(prop["xlabel"])
00095         self.axesaxes.set_ylabel(prop["ylabel"])
00096         self.axesaxes.set_title(prop["title"])
00097 
00098         # Properties defined by user
00099         self.axesaxes.grid(True)
00100 
00101     def clear(self):
00102         """Reset the plot"""
00103         
00104         # TODO: Redraw is brutal.  Render to a backing store and swap in
00105         # TODO: rather than redrawing on the fly.
00106         self.axesaxes.clear()
00107         self.axesaxes.hold(True)
00108 
00109     def render(self):
00110         """Commit the plot after all objects are drawn"""
00111         # TODO: this is when the backing store should be swapped in.
00112         self.axesaxes.legend()
00113         pass
00114 
00115     def xaxis(self,label,units):
00116         """xaxis label and units.
00117         
00118         Axis labels know about units.
00119         
00120         We need to do this so that we can detect when axes are not
00121         commesurate.  Currently this is ignored other than for formatting
00122         purposes.
00123         """
00124         if units != "": label = label + " (" + units + ")"
00125         self.axesaxes.set_xlabel(label)
00126         pass
00127     
00128     def yaxis(self,label,units):
00129         """yaxis label and units."""
00130         if units != "": label = label + " (" + units + ")"
00131         self.axesaxes.set_ylabel(label)
00132         pass
00133 
00134     def _connect_to_xlim(self,callback):
00135         """Bind the xlim change notification to the callback"""
00136         def process_xlim(axes):
00137             lo,hi = axes.get_xlim()
00138             callback(lo,hi)
00139         self.axesaxes.callbacks.connect('xlim_changed',process_xlim)
00140     
00141     def connect(self,trigger,callback):
00142         if trigger == 'xlim': self._connect_to_xlim_connect_to_xlim(callback)
00143 
00144     def points(self,x,y,dx=None,dy=None,color=0,symbol=0,label=None):
00145         """Draw markers with error bars"""
00146         # Convert tuple (lo,hi) to array [(x-lo),(hi-x)]
00147         if dx != None and type(dx) == type(()):
00148             dx = nx.vstack((x-dx[0],dx[1]-x)).transpose()
00149         if dy != None and type(dy) == type(()):
00150             dy = nx.vstack((y-dy[0],dy[1]-y)).transpose()
00151 
00152         if True or dx is None and dy is None:
00153             self.lineslines = self.axesaxes.plot(x,y,color=self._color_color(color),
00154                                    marker=self._symbol_symbol(symbol))
00155         else:
00156             self.lineslines, hcap, hbar = self.axesaxes.errorbar(x,y,dy,color=self._color_color(color),
00157                                              marker=self._symbol_symbol(symbol), 
00158                                              linestyle='None',
00159                                              label=label,picker=5)
00160 
00161     def curve(self,x,y,dy=None,color=0,symbol=0,label=None):
00162         """Draw a line on a graph, possibly with confidence intervals."""
00163         c = self._color_color(color)
00164         hlist = self.axesaxes.plot(x,y,color=c,marker='',linestyle='-',label=label)
00165         if False and dy != None:
00166             if type(dy) == type(()):
00167                 self.axesaxes.plot(x,dy[0],color=c,
00168                                marker='',linestyle='--',label='_nolegend_')
00169                 self.axesaxes.plot(x,dy[1],color=c,
00170                                marker='',linestyle='--',label='_nolegend_')
00171             else:
00172                 self.axesaxes.plot(x,y+dy,color=c,
00173                                marker='',linestyle='--',label='_nolegend_')
00174                 self.axesaxes.plot(x,y-dy,color=c,
00175                                marker='',linestyle='--',label='_nolegend_')
00176 
00177     def _color(self,c):
00178         """Return a particular colour"""
00179         return self.colorlistcolorlist[c%len(self.colorlistcolorlist)]
00180 
00181     def _symbol(self,s):
00182         """Return a particular symbol"""
00183         return self.symbollistsymbollist[s%len(self.symbollistsymbollist)]
